title: Analyzing EU Funding Data with eufundr
text: vignette demonstrates use eufundr package download publicly available EU funding data multiple sources

what: Download all data for Finland from all sources
title: Analyzing EU Funding Data with eufundr
text: Access specific parts
code: all_data <- get_all_data("FI") projects <- all_data$kohesio_projects beneficiaries <- all_data$kohesio_beneficiaries fts <- all_data$fts horizon2020 <- all_data$horizon_2020 horizon_europe <- all_data$horizon_europe interreg <- all_data$interreg

what: Download only certain country and sources
title: Analyzing EU Funding Data with eufundr
text: Get Greek kohesio projects Get Romanian kohesio beneficiaries Get Dutch FTS data year 2024 Get Swedish Horizon data Get Danish h2020 data Get German interreg data
code: kohesio_projects = get_kohesio_projects(country = "GR") kohesio_beneficiaries = get_kohesio_beneficiaries(country = "RO") fts = get_fts_data(year = 2024, country =  "NL") horizon = get_horizon_data(programme = "HORIZON", country = "SE") h2020 = get_horizon_data(programme = "h2020", country = "DK") interreg = get_interreg_data(country = "DE")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Risto Kaartinen. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kaartinen R (2025). eufundr: Tools Downloading Processing EU Funding Data. R package version 0.0.1, https://dataninjafi.github.io/eufundr/, https://github.com/dataninjafi/eufundr.
code: @Manual{,   title = {eufundr: Tools for Downloading and Processing EU Funding Data},   author = {Risto Kaartinen},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.1, https://dataninjafi.github.io/eufundr/},   url = {https://github.com/dataninjafi/eufundr}, }

title: eufundr
text: eufundr R package downloading publicly available EU funding data multiple official sources: Kohesio: EU Cohesion Policy projects beneficiaries. https://kohesio.ec.europa.eu/en/data FTS: Financial Transparency System (EU budget expenditures) https://ec.europa.eu/budget/financial-transparency-system/help.html#download-data CORDIS: Horizon Europe Horizon 2020 research funding data https://cordis.europa.eu/projects Interreg: keep.eu contains data Interreg IPA-IPA cross-border projects approved contracted also includes projects EU instruments funds contribute macro-regional strategies (2020). package uses data served web page API. Also documentation data somewhere web pages. One use case data loading tool download data exploration beneficiary (company, organization) double funded. One can explore company ids, company names, project names project descriptions data. Data can answer questions like “purpose company receive data? companies received grants purposes?”

title: eufundr
text: order use package need R version 4.1 newer remotes-package installed.

title: eufundr
code: library(eufundr)  # Download all data for Finland all_data <- get_all_data("FI")  # Access specific parts projects <- all_data$kohesio_projects beneficiaries <- all_data$kohesio_beneficiaries fts <- all_data$fts horizon2020 <- all_data$horizon_2020 horizon_europe <- all_data$horizon_europe interreg <- all_data$interreg  # Download only certain country and sources  ## Get Greek kohesio projects  kohesio_projects = get_kohesio_projects(country = "GR")  ## Get Romanian beneficiaries      kohesio_beneficiaries = get_kohesio_beneficiaries(country = "RO")  ## Get Dutch FTS data for year 2024 fts = get_fts_data(year = 2024, country =  "NL")  ## Get Swedish Horizon data horizon = get_horizon_data(programme = "HORIZON", country = "SE")  ## Get Danish h2020 data h2020 = get_horizon_data(programme = "h2020", country = "DK")  ## Get Portugese interreg data interreg = get_interreg_data(country = "PT")

title: eufundr
text: Pull requests issues welcome! project follows open data open science ethos.

title: eufundr
text: MIT © Risto Kaartinen

what: Enrich country names or codes with EU membership information — enrich_eu_country_info
title: Enrich country names or codes with EU membership information — enrich_eu_country_info
text: helper function checks whether provided country names ISO2 codes belong EU member states (based EU-28 list available countrycode).

title: Enrich country names or codes with EU membership information — enrich_eu_country_info
Enrich country names or codes with EU membership information — enrich_eu_country_info
text: country character vector country names (English) ISO2 country codes.

title: Enrich country names or codes with EU membership information — enrich_eu_country_info
text: character vector containing matching country names ISO2 codes EU-28 member states. Returns empty vector match found.

title: Enrich country names or codes with EU membership information — enrich_eu_country_info
text: function relies countrycode::codelist retrieve list EU-28 countries. filters EU-28 members (eu28 NA) matches English country names (country.name.en) ISO2 codes (iso2c).

text: Get EU funding datasets single call

Get all EU funding datasets in a single call — get_all_data

what: Retrieve Interreg project data from keep.eu API — get_interreg_data
title: Retrieve Interreg project data from keep.eu API — get_interreg_data
text: function sends POST request [keep.eu](https://keep.eu) API downloads Excel file containing data Interreg projects partners. results can filtered country specified.

title: Retrieve Interreg project data from keep.eu API — get_interreg_data
Retrieve Interreg project data from keep.eu API — get_interreg_data
text: country character string vector indicating country name(s) code(s) filter results . `NULL`, data countries returned.

title: Retrieve Interreg project data from keep.eu API — get_interreg_data
text: list two elements: partners tibble containing partner data, optionally filtered country. projects tibble containing project data linked filtered partners.

title: Retrieve Interreg project data from keep.eu API — get_interreg_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # Retrieve all projects and partners   data <- get_interreg_data()    # Retrieve only projects related to Finland   data <- get_interreg_data(country = "Finland") } # }
